content.title: West Bengal Artisans Financial Benefit Scheme 2024: Grant to Individual Artisans
content.department: Micro, Small & Medium Enterprise and Textiles Department
content.details: This scheme provides a one-time grant up to ₹15,000 for individual artisans for the purchase and repair of tool kits/equipment.
benefits: One-time grant up to ₹15,000 for toolkits/equipment
content.application_process: Applications by individual artisans or by the Cooperative Societies of the artisans are to be submitted at BDO's office for rural areas, at SDO’s office for Municipality areas and at the Municipal Corporation Office for the urban areas.

faqs.question: What is the classification of Crafts and Trades?
faqs.answer: All crafts and trades performed by handicrafts artisans across the state and other age-old traditional trades like Blacksmithy, Pottery, Carpentry, Masonry, Garland making (Malakar), Shoe making (Charmakar), Washerman (Dhobi), Boat making, Fishing, Net making, Broom making, Coir product making, Clay Doll making, Folk/Musical instrument making, Puppetry, Basketry, Locksmith, Goldsmithy, Barber etc.

faqs.question: How will the procurement and reimbursement process work for individual artisans under this scheme?
faqs.answer: For individual artisans/trades, the toolkits shall be procured by the beneficiaries themselves and the same shall be reimbursed up to ₹15,000/- on production of such vouchers and on verification.

faqs.question: What process will be followed by the department for the administration of this scheme?
faqs.answer: The applications in Panchayat areas will be screened fortnightly by a Screening Committee in the BDO Office, those in Municipality areas will be screened by a Screening Committee at SDO’s Office and for Corporation areas, applications will be screened by a Screening Committee at Corporation office. Relevant checklist & inspection format will be finalised by the Directorate of MSME.

faqs.question: What measures are in place to prevent misuse of the Welfare Assistance?
faqs.answer: In case of any misrepresentation of facts or furnishing false information by an applicant, all his/her claims under the scheme shall be revoked.

faqs.question: What is the date of commencement and duration of this scheme?
faqs.answer: This scheme was launched on 7th March, 2024 and will remain in force for five years.

faqs.question: How the Grievance Redressal Mechanism shall operate for this scheme?
faqs.answer: In case of any grievance against the decision of the GM Concerned, application to be made to the Director MSME. In case of any interpretation regarding the scheme, Director MSME may consult the Department of MSME&T before taking any final decision.

faqs.question: How can the benefits be availed?
faqs.answer: Applications by individual artisans or by the Cooperative Societies of the artisans are to be submitted at BDO's office for rural areas, at SDO’s office for Municipality areas and at the Municipal Corporation Office for the urban areas.
